page.title: 18THE GRAVETYE/MOATLANDS AREA
page.content: Close by{Gravetye Manor}is the half timbered 14th century{Moat House situated on a hammer pond. This became the home of the{Tudor ironmaster {Richard Infield}who then, in 1597, built the Manor House. The Moat can be reached by taking the footpath off {Vowels Lane}to Moatlands. This is one of the early cart tracks that was used to carry iron ore to the furnaces in the valley below. After passing the Moat, there is a choice of paths to climb up to the{West Hoathly}road, with attractive views looking down on the{Gravetye Woods. Opposite the entrance to Moatlands is a long established{boarding kennels for cats and dogs.
